words.meaning: The rear surface or part of something; the side or surface of an object that is opposite its front.
words.sentence: He sat on the backside of the bench to get a better view of the field.

words.meaning: Free from error; true, accurate, or right in every detail; to make right, accurate, or true; to rectify.
words.sentence: She corrected her mistake on the test before turning it in.

words.meaning: The ridge over the eye; the forehead; the peak or highest part of something.
words.sentence: He wiped the sweat from his brow after working in the hot sun.

words.meaning: Airtight; sealed so that no air can enter or escape; completely closed or isolated from external influences.
words.sentence: The hermetic seal on the container kept the food fresh for a long time.

words.meaning: Requiring immediate action or attention; pressing; important.
words.sentence: She received an urgent message asking her to come to the hospital immediately.

words.meaning: Lacking in seriousness or sense; foolish; absurd.
words.sentence: The children giggled at their silly jokes.

words.meaning: Of vital importance; crucial; giving an authoritative command; necessary or required.
words.sentence: It is imperative that we arrive on time for the meeting.

words.meaning: To make something weaker in force, content, or value by adding water or another solvent.
words.sentence: The chef had to dilute the sauce because it was too strong.

words.meaning: Successful or flourishing, especially financially; bringing wealth, success, or good fortune.
words.sentence: The city experienced a prosperous period of economic growth.

words.meaning: To invent or concoct something, typically with deceitful intent; to construct or manufacture something, especially from prepared components.
words.sentence: The witness admitted to fabricating the story to avoid punishment.

words.meaning: Fair and sensible; based on good sense or sound judgment; not excessive or extreme.
words.sentence: She offered a reasonable explanation for being late.

words.meaning: Required by law or rule; compulsory; obligatory.
words.sentence: Wearing a seatbelt is mandatory while driving.

words.meaning: To forcibly put an end to something; to prevent the development, action, or expression of something.
words.sentence: The government tried to suppress the protest, but the demonstrators remained defiant.

words.meaning: Having all necessary parts or elements; not lacking anything; finished; to bring to a finished state.
words.sentence: Please complete the form and return it to the office.

words.meaning: Clear and easily understood; rational or sane.
words.sentence: His lucid explanations helped the students understand the complex topic.

words.meaning: Showing a great deal of variety; varied or diverse in nature.
words.sentence: The city boasts a diverse population representing many different cultures.

words.meaning: Required to be done, achieved, or present; essential; indispensable.
words.sentence: Food and water are necessary for survival.

words.meaning: Deep regret or guilt for a wrong committed; contrition.
words.sentence: She felt remorse for her harsh words and apologized.

words.meaning: To tame or adapt an animal or plant to live in close association with humans; to bring under control; to make domestic.
words.sentence: Humans began to domesticate dogs thousands of years ago.

words.meaning: Firmly fixed, supported, or balanced; not faltering or wavering; constant or regular.
words.sentence: She took a deep breath to steady her nerves before the big presentation.

words.meaning: Something that serves as a sign or evidence of a specified fact, event, or quality.
words.sentence: Her kindness toward others was a testament to her compassionate nature.

words.meaning: Relevant or appropriate; capable of being applied; able to be put to practical use.
words.sentence: The rules are applicable to all employees, regardless of their position.

words.meaning: Needing much effort or skill to accomplish, deal with, or understand; not easy.
words.sentence: Learning a new language can be difficult, but it's also rewarding.

words.meaning: To repair or fix something that is broken or damaged; to improve a difficult or strained situation.
words.sentence: He tried to mend the broken vase with glue.

words.meaning: Concerned with principles of right and wrong behavior; ethical; relating to principles of right and wrong in behavior.
words.sentence: The story taught an important moral lesson about honesty.

words.meaning: The beliefs or opinions that are generally held about someone or something; the overall quality or character as seen or judged by people in general.
words.sentence: Her reputation as a reliable employee earned her a promotion.

words.meaning: A deduction from the usual cost of something, typically given for prompt or advance payment or to a special category of buyers; to regard something as being unworthy of consideration or to underestimate its value.
words.sentence: The store offered a 20% discount on all items for the weekend.

words.meaning: To come into sight; to become visible or noticeable; to give the impression of being something or having a particular quality.
words.sentence: The stars appear in the sky at night.

words.meaning: To continue to live or exist, especially in spite of danger or hardship; to remain alive after the death of someone else.
words.sentence: Despite the harsh conditions, the plant managed to survive.

words.meaning: Having a relaxed, friendly, or unofficial style, manner, or nature; not formal.
words.sentence: The dress code for the party is informal, so feel free to dress comfortably.

words.meaning: Full of life or excitement; lively.
words.sentence: The animated discussion brightened up the room.

words.meaning: To make someone uncertain or unable to understand something; to perplex.
words.sentence: His unclear instructions confused the students.

words.meaning: In or to a foreign country, especially one across the sea.
words.sentence: She travels overseas for work frequently.

words.meaning: Situated or placed higher than the surrounding area; raised above the ground.
words.sentence: The elevated platform provided a clear view of the entire city.

words.meaning: To return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength after illness, injury, or difficulty; to regain possession or control of something.
words.sentence: He needed time to recover from the flu.

words.meaning: To complain about something in a bad-tempered way; to grumble.
words.sentence: The students grumbled about the long assignment.

words.meaning: To tell someone confidently or firmly that something is true or will happen as stated; to make someone certain.
words.sentence: He assured his parents that he would be home before midnight.

words.meaning: A thing used to make something look more attractive but usually having no practical purpose; to decorate or add beauty to something.
words.sentence: The Christmas tree was adorned with colorful ornaments.

words.meaning: Very great in size, amount, degree, intensity, or extent; immense.
words.sentence: The desert stretched out before them, a vast expanse of sand.

words.meaning: To make or become less; to decrease in size, extent, or importance.
words.sentence: The company's profits began to diminish as competition increased.

words.meaning: To rise in rebellion against an authority or government; to refuse to accept or be controlled by something.
words.sentence: The citizens decided to revolt against the oppressive regime.

words.meaning: Mentally or physically inactive; lethargic; slow and apathetic.
words.sentence: The heat made him feel torpid and unwilling to move.

words.meaning: The force or energy with which a body moves; a driving force; something that encourages a particular action or makes it more energetic or effective.
words.sentence: The new tax law provided an impetus for people to invest in renewable energy.

words.meaning: To bring or gather together; to accumulate; to pick up or gather things.
words.sentence: She collected shells on the beach during her vacation.

words.meaning: Bright or glossy in appearance; reflecting light.
words.sentence: The car's shiny new paint job made it stand out on the road.

words.meaning: Having no real value or use; not important or useful.
words.sentence: The old computer was worthless and couldn't be repaired.

words.meaning: To take away or eliminate something; to extract or displace from a particular place.
words.sentence: He used a sponge to remove the stain from the carpet.

words.meaning: To give support, confidence, or hope to someone; to inspire with courage, spirit, or confidence.
words.sentence: His friends encouraged him to pursue his dreams.

words.meaning: A state of great disturbance, confusion, or uncertainty; chaos.
words.sentence: The country was in turmoil following the political upheaval.

words.meaning: To cut something into pieces with repeated sharp blows of an ax, knife, or other cutting tool; a sharp downward blow or stroke.
words.sentence: She chopped vegetables for the soup.

words.meaning: To include or contain as part of a whole; to engage or participate in.
words.sentence: The project will involve working with various departments.

words.meaning: To move in a circular orbit around a central point; to rotate or spin.
words.sentence: The Earth revolves around the Sun.

words.meaning: Content or pleased because one's desires or expectations have been fulfilled.
words.sentence: After completing the project, she felt satisfied with her work.

words.meaning: To become or make more intense; to strengthen or increase in degree or severity.
words.sentence: The storm is expected to intensify as it approaches the coast.

words.meaning: A concise summary or abstract of a text or speech; a brief statement or account of the main points.
words.sentence: She provided a precis of the article for her presentation.
